diagnosis.final_diagnosis: myotonia permanens due to a new SCN4A mutation (p.P1158L)
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The clinical phenotype and functional alterations of the P1158L mutation support the diagnosis of myotonia permanens. This includes pronounced myotonia, slowness of movements, generalized muscle hypertrophy, and a satisfactory response to flecainide treatment, while the patient had an unsatisfactory response to mexiletine due to discomfort and reduced drug sensitivity observed in vitro.
